title: Post-Covid, Procurement Still Under-Resourced

title: Alarms will be sounding at Qantas, but not in the cockpit
summary: Qantas has seen a significant decline in its rankings in the World Airline Awards, plummeting from fifth in 2022 to 24th in 2023. The airline's recent controversies, including the illegal dismissal of ground crew and selling seats on non-existent flights, highlight a management more focused on profits than customer satisfaction. This has led to widespread criticism and a tarnished reputation for the national carrier.
